What is the definition of the term coverage?
answers: The activity of establishing or updating a test plan.
The degree to which specified coverage items are exercised by a test suite, expressed as a percentage.
A procedure used to define test conditions, design test cases, and specify test data.
A group of test activities based on specific test objectives aimed at specific characteristics of a component or system.

questions.question: What is the definition of the term equivalence partitioning?
answers: A black-box test technique in which test conditions are equivalence partitions exercised by one representative member of each partition.
A test technique based on the internal structure of a component or system.
A black-box test technique in which test cases are designed based on boundary values.
A black-box test technique in which test cases are designed to exercise the combinations of conditions and the resulting actions shown in a decision table.

questions.question: What is the name of the term defined as follows? The measure of a risk defined by risk impact and risk likelihood.
What is the definition of the term root cause?
answers: Documentation of the occurrence, nature, and status of a defect.
The process of finding, analyzing and removing the causes of failures in a component or system.
A type of change-related testing to detect whether defects have been introduced or uncovered in unchanged areas of the software.
A source of a defect such that if it is removed, the occurrence of the defect type is decreased or removed.

questions.question: What is the definition of the term system testing?
answers: Testing performed to evaluate that a component or system complies with non-functional requirements.
A test technique based on the specification of a component or system.
A test level that focuses on verifying that a system as a whole meets specified requirements.
A test level that focuses on individual hardware or software components.

questions.question: What is the name of the term defined as follows? The use of software to perform or support test activities.
What is the definition of the term test execution?
answers: The process of evaluating a component or system without executing it, based on its form, structure, content, or documentation.
A test level that focuses on interactions between components or systems.
The activity that identifies test conditions by analyzing the test basis.
The activity that runs a test on a component or system producing actual results.

questions.question: What is the name of the term defined as follows? The activity that prepares the testware needed for test execution based on test analysis and design.
What is the name of the term defined as follows? The purpose for testing.
What is the name of the term defined as follows? A group of test activities based on specific test objectives aimed at specific characteristics of a component or system.
What is the definition of the term acceptance criteria?
answers: Testing performed to evaluate that a component or system complies with non-functional requirements.
Testing based on an analysis of the specification of the component or system.
The set of conditions for officially completing a defined task.
The criteria that a component or system must satisfy in order to be accepted by a user, customer, or other authorized entity.

questions.question: What is the definition of the term acceptance testing?
answers: The manner of implementing testing tasks.
A test level that focuses on determining whether to accept the system.
Testing that involves the execution of the test item.
A test level that focuses on individual hardware or software components.

questions.question: What is the name of the term defined as follows? A test technique based on the specification of a component or system.
What is the definition of the term confirmation testing?
answers: A source of a defect such that if it is removed, the occurrence of the defect type is decreased or removed.
A type of change-related testing performed after fixing a defect to confirm that a failure caused by that defect does not reoccur.
Testing that involves the execution of the test item.
Documentation of the occurrence, nature, and status of a defect.

questions.question: What is the name of the term defined as follows? Testing performed to evaluate if a component or system satisfies functional requirements.
What is the definition of the term project risk?
answers: The process of finding, recognizing and describing risks.
The process through which decisions are reached and protective measures are implemented for reducing or maintaining risks to specified levels.
The activity that checks and reports the status of known risks to stakeholders.
A risk that impacts project success.

questions.question: What is the name of the term defined as follows? A set of preconditions, inputs, actions (where applicable), expected results and postconditions, developed based on test conditions.
What is the definition of the term test design?
answers: Testing that involves the execution of the test item.
A procedure used to define test conditions, design test cases, and specify test data.
The activity that derives and specifies test cases from test conditions.
A sequence of test cases in execution order and any associated actions that may be required to set up the initial preconditions and any wrap-up activities after execution.

questions.question: What is the name of the term defined as follows? A sequence of test cases in execution order and any associated actions that may be required to set up the initial preconditions and any wrap-up activities after execution.
What is the definition of the term shift left?
answers: A test approach to perform testing and quality assurance activities as early as possible in the software development lifecycle.
The process within the software development lifecycle that evaluates the quality of a component or system and related work products.
Testing in which the management, selection, prioritization, and use of testing activities and resources are based on corresponding risk types and risk levels.
A description of how to perform testing to reach test objectives under given circumstances.

questions.question: What is the name of the term defined as follows? The process of recognizing, recording, classifying, investigating, resolving and disposing of defects.
What is the name of the term defined as follows? The set of conditions for officially starting a defined task.
What is the name of the term defined as follows? A test technique based on the tester's experience, knowledge and intuition.
What is the name of the term defined as follows? A risk that impacts project success.
What is the definition of the term static testing?
answers: The activity that derives and specifies test cases from test conditions.
Testing that does not involve the execution of a test item.
A description of how to perform testing to reach test objectives under given circumstances.
A testable aspect of a component or system identified as a basis for testing.

questions.question: What is the name of the term defined as follows? The integration testing of systems.
What is the name of the term defined as follows? A test level that focuses on verifying that a system as a whole meets specified requirements.
What is the name of the term defined as follows? A type of test report produced at completion milestones that provides an evaluation of the corresponding test items against exit criteria.
What is the name of the term defined as follows? The ability to establish explicit relationships between related work products or items within work products.
What is the name of the term defined as follows? Confirmation by examination that a work product matches a stakeholder's needs.
What is a primary objective of software testing?
answers: To ensure the software is completely defect-free
To validate that the software meets stakeholder needs
To replace the need for debugging
To eliminate the need for quality assurance

questions.question: How does testing differ from debugging?
answers: Testing fixes defects, while debugging identifies them
Testing identifies defects or triggers failures, while debugging diagnoses and fixes defects
Testing is performed only statically, while debugging is dynamic
Testing is a process-oriented activity, while debugging is product-oriented

questions.question: Which of the following is a testing principle?
answers: Testing proves the absence of defects
Defects cluster together in a small number of components

questions.question: What is the main difference between testing and quality assurance (QA)?
answers: Testing is process-oriented, while QA is product-oriented
Testing focuses on defect detection, while QA focuses on process improvement
Testing is performed only by testers, while QA is performed by developers
Testing ensures compliance with regulations, while QA does not

questions.question: Which activity is part of the test implementation phase?
answers: Creating test data and test scripts
Comparing actual progress against the test plan
Analyzing lessons learned for future projects

questions.question: Why is traceability between the test basis and testware important?
answers: It ensures all defects are fixed during debugging
It supports coverage evaluation and impact analysis
It eliminates the need for test automation
It replaces the need for test planning

questions.question: Which skill is particularly relevant for testers to effectively identify defects?

answers: It ensures complete independence of testers
It enhances collaboration and leverages diverse skill sets
It eliminates the need for test automation
It reduces the need for stakeholder involvement

questions.question: What is a drawback of high independence in testing?
answers: Independent testers may find fewer defects
It may lead to isolation from the development team
It eliminates the need for communication skills
It ensures all defects are found

questions.question: What does the testing principle "absence-of-defects fallacy" imply?

Fixing all defects may not meet user needs or business goals
Defects are evenly distributed across components

questions.question: What is the main purpose of testing?
answers: To ensure the code runs without errors
To find and fix all the bugs
To evaluate quality and reduce the risk of software failure

questions.question: Which of the following is a typical test objective?

answers: Testing is done only after debugging
Debugging is a static process, while testing is dynamic
Testing finds failures; debugging identifies and fixes the causes
Testing involves fixing defects; debugging reports them

questions.question: What is the correct order in the cause-effect chain?

answers: Testing shows presence, not absence of defects
Early testing saves time and money

questions.question: What is the main benefit of early testing?

It delays the project until code is written

questions.question: What is the purpose of test traceability?

To link test cases to requirements and risks

questions.question: What is meant by "testware"?

answers: Testers can find different defects due to different perspectives

questions.question: What is the “whole team approach” in testing?
answers: Only the QA team is responsible for testing

It ensures testing is only performed at the end of the SDLC

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a test-first approach?

It ensures all testing is performed manually

questions.question: What does the "shift left" approach in testing emphasize?

Eliminating the need for non-functional testing

questions.question: What is a key benefit of retrospectives in testing?

questions.question: Which test level focuses on testing the interfaces between components?

To check how well the system behaves
To test the internal structure of the system
To ensure all defects are fixed

questions.question: How does confirmation testing differ from regression testing?

Confirmation testing is always automated, while regression testing is manual
Confirmation testing is performed only at the system level, while regression testing is at the component level

questions.question: What is a common trigger for maintenance testing?

Modifying an operational system with enhancements or fixes
Eliminating the need for regression testing

questions.question: Which of the following work products is typically NOT suitable for static testing?

Static testing can only be applied to executable work products.
Dynamic testing is performed early in the SDLC, while static testing is performed later.
